moves.1. e4 a6: What?!Clearly this opening move must be wrong!I was inspired to move this after seeing a game where Anthony Miles beat Karpov(!) with this opening.
moves.2... b5: Developing the Bishop and trying to control the c4-square.
moves.3. Nf3 Bb7 4. e5: !?This is a rare move.4.Bd3 is more normal.
moves.9. Re1 Be7 10. Bxe7 Ngxe7 11. Nbd2 O-O: !?Inviting an attack.Since I decided my d4 pawn was a goner,I decided to castle.I had been half expecting for my opponent to sac on h7,but I decided that the worst I could do is draw with good play.The flow of the game changes and the rest is a good example of attack and defence
moves.12. Bxh7+ Kxh7 13. Ng5+ Kh6 14. Re4: 14...Kxg5? is suicidal.14...Kxg5 15.Qg4+ Kh6 16. Qh4+ Kg6 17.Rg4+ Kf5 18.Qg5#
moves.14... Nxe5: In the midist of the attack Black lights up a cigar and grabs a pawn.
moves.15. Rh4+ Kxg5 16. f4+ Kf6: You have to know when to stop being greedy.16...Kxh4?? 17.g3+ Kh3 18.Qh5#
moves.17. Qh5 g6: ! A good move!Black needs to make some breathing space for the king.Nevertheless White still has a draw.
moves.18. Qg5+ Kg7 19. fxe5: ?The losing move!White had a draw with 19.Qh6+ Kf6 20.Qg5+ etc. However this attempt for a win loses!
moves.19... Ng8: !! The only move!This covers both of Black's weak points at f6 and h6 simultaneously! Black would be mated if any other move was played.
moves.20. Rxd4 Qd8: The rest doesn't need much explanation.Black tries to trade pieces while White tries to rekindle his attack.
